noun.description: The action or process of producing something, especially a list, book, or report, by assembling information collected from other sources.
examples: great care has been taken in the compilation of this guidebook

noun.description: A thing, especially a book, record, or broadcast program, that is put together by assembling previously separate items.
examples: there are thirty-three stories in this compilation

origin: Late Middle English: via Old French from Latin compilatio(n-), from compilare to plunder (see compile).
